EXTM3U.summary: Required first line of every Media Playlist and every Multivariant Playlist.

EXT-X-VERSION.summary: Indicates the compatibility version of the Playlist file. Must appear in all playlists containing tags or attributes that are version-specific.

EXTINF.summary: Specifies the duration of a Media Segment. Must be followed by the Media Segment URI. Duration is a decimal-floating-point or decimal-integer number in seconds.

EXT-X-BYTERANGE.summary: Specifies a byte range into a resource for loading a Media Segment. Format is: n[@o] where n is the length in bytes and o is the offset from start.

EXT-X-DISCONTINUITY.summary: Indicates a discontinuity between the Media Segment following it and the one preceding it. Can affect timing, encoding, or other stream attributes.

EXT-X-KEY.summary: Specifies how to decrypt Media Segments that follow it. Includes encryption method, key URI, initialization vector, and other encryption parameters.

EXT-X-MAP.summary: Specifies how to obtain Media Initialization Section required to parse any Media Segments that follow it.

EXT-X-PROGRAM-DATE-TIME.summary: Associates the first sample of a Media Segment with an absolute date and/or time. Format is ISO/IEC 8601:2004 date/time string.

EXT-X-DATERANGE.summary: Associates a date range (time range) with metadata. Used for tracking events or program boundaries.

EXT-X-TARGETDURATION.summary: Specifies the maximum Media Segment duration. Required in Media Playlist. Value is a decimal-integer in seconds.

EXT-X-MEDIA-SEQUENCE.summary: Indicates the Media Sequence Number of the first Media Segment. If not present, defaults to 0.

EXT-X-DISCONTINUITY-SEQUENCE.summary: Allows synchronization between different Renditions of the same Variant Stream or different Variant Streams.

EXT-X-ENDLIST.summary: Indicates that no more Media Segments will be added to the Media Playlist. Required for Video-on-Demand.

EXT-X-PLAYLIST-TYPE.summary: Provides mutability information about the Media Playlist file. Values can be EVENT or VOD.

EXT-X-I-FRAMES-ONLY.summary: Indicates that each Media Segment in the Playlist describes a single I-frame. Used for trick play support.

EXT-X-MEDIA.summary: Used in Multivariant Playlists to specify alternative Renditions. Commonly used for audio, subtitles, and closed captions.

EXT-X-STREAM-INF.summary: Specifies a Variant Stream, which is a set of Renditions that can be combined to play the presentation. Must be followed by URI.

EXT-X-I-FRAME-STREAM-INF.summary: Specifies a Variant Stream containing I-frames only. Used for trick play support without requiring additional bandwidth.

EXT-X-SESSION-DATA.summary: Allows arbitrary session data to be carried in a Multivariant Playlist. Data can be inline or loaded from external URI.

EXT-X-SESSION-KEY.summary: Allows encryption keys to be preloaded at session start, reducing load time. Functions like EXT-X-KEY but applies to all Variant Streams.

EXT-X-INDEPENDENT-SEGMENTS.summary: Indicates that all media samples in a Media Segment can be decoded without information from other segments. Applies to all segments that follow.

EXT-X-START.summary: Indicates a preferred point at which to start playing a Playlist. Includes time offset and precise start point flag.

EXT-X-CONTENT-STEERING.summary: Allows a server to provide a Content Steering Manifest, enabling dynamic adjustment of content delivery paths.

EXT-X-PART.summary: Identifies a Partial Segment, which is a sub-range of a Media Segment, allowing for lower latency streaming.

EXT-X-PART-INF.summary: Specifies attributes that apply to all Partial Segments in a Playlist, such as the PART-TARGET duration.

EXT-X-SERVER-CONTROL.summary: Provides directives that influence client playback behavior, such as specifying whether the server supports low-latency streaming.

EXT-X-SKIP.summary: Instructs clients to skip over a specified number of Media Segments, useful for faster playlist updates.

EXT-X-PRELOAD-HINT.summary: Provides a hint to the client about a resource that is expected to become available soon, enabling preloading and reducing latency.

EXT-X-RENDITION-REPORT.summary: Allows a client to report its playback position in different Renditions, facilitating synchronization across variants.

EXT-X-BITRATE.summary: Identifies the approximate segment bit rate of the Media Segment(s) to which it applies. It applies to every Media Segment between it and the next EXT-X-BITRATE tag in the Playlist file (or the end of the Playlist file) that does not have an EXT-X-BYTERANGE tag applied to it.

EXT-X-GAP.summary: Indicates that the segment URI to which it applies does not contain media data and SHOULD NOT be loaded by clients. It applies only to the next Media Segment.

EXT-X-CUE-OUT.summary: Indicates that the following media segment is a splice out point.

EXT-X-CUE-IN.summary: Indicates that the following media segment is a splice in point.

EXT-OATCLS-SCTE35.summary: Contains SCTE-35 data in base64 format

EXT-X-SPLICEPOINT-SCTE35.summary: Contains SCTE-35 data in base64 format
